Pre-Game Insights: The Baltimore Orioles (77-58) are welcoming the Chicago White Sox (31-104) at Oriole Park at Camden Yards on Monday.
The expected starting pitchers will be Chris Flexen and Corbin Burnes.
The White Sox have tallied 201 doubles as a squad and have hit 109 baseballs out of the park.
Chicago has a slugging rate of .342 and have been rung up 1,172 times, while drawing a walk on 331 occasions.
As a team, the Chicago White Sox are compiling 3.1 runs per game, which ranks them 30th in the league.
They have amassed 397 RBI's as well as 984 hits over the course of the season, and their team batting average is sitting at .220.
They have a total of 416 runs scored while having a team on-base percentage of .278.
The White Sox hold a team ERA of 4.86 on the season (29th in baseball), and their staff has rung up 1,109 batters.
The Baltimore Orioles hold a team OBP of .315 as well as a team batting average of .250 for the season.
Baltimore has hit 202 home runs over the course of the season to go along with 646 RBIs.
The Orioles have a team SLG% of .442 and they average 4.95 runs per game (3rd in baseball).
The Baltimore pitching staff have conceded 586 runs on the campaign while having an ERA of 3.95 (527 earned runs surrendered).
The Orioles hold a team WHIP of 1.237 and are the owners of a FIP of 3.93 as a staff for the year.
